SEARCH
Package tempest_foundation.Testing

Interface Test

All Known Implementing Classes:
AccessorTest, ConstructorTest, VariableTest
public interface Test
The interface representing a test to be executed on a class.

This interface defines the essential methods for setting up and executing tests on class details, including assigning grades for the test results. Any class that implements this interface is expected to define the behavior of how tests are executed and how grades are calculated based on the class content.

Author:
Jared De Four

  • Method Details

    • executeTest

      void executeTest()
      Executes the test on the assigned class details.

      This method contains the logic for running the test on the Class details. It typically evaluates the class structure, methods, or other elements and records the results, which includes assigning a grade, generating comments and eventuallyy outputting.

    • setClassDetails

      void setClassDetails(ClassDetails inTesting)
      Sets the class details to be tested.

      This method assigns the class details to be tested. It is typically called before executing the test to ensure the correct class is being evaluated.

      Parameters:
      inTesting - the class details to be tested.

    • setGrade

      void setGrade(double grade)
      Sets the grade for the test.

      This method is used to set the grade for the test. The grade can be used later to calculate the overall score or feedback for the class or student.

      Parameters:
      grade - the grade for the test.
